# RivestShamirAdleman - 50

We are given the file ```prob.txt```.
It contains the following:

```python
n = 

e = 3

c = 56274920108122478990888092521371739605513959053322262229138771723654033167756128122086229722406180593128664696512912311575327724724695863345048713415525599333
```
The important thing here is that ```e = 3```, this means that a cubed root attack is probably the solution.



![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?%5C%5C%20c%20%3D%20p%5E%7Be%7D%5C%3A%28mod%5C%3An%29%5C%5C%20%5C%5C%20p%20%3D%20%5Csqrt%5Be%5D%7Bc%7D%20%5C%3A%5C%3A%20%28if%5C%3A%5C%3A%5C%3Ap%5E%7Be%7D%5C%3A%5C%3A%3C%5C%3An%29%5C%5C)

With these equations we can write a simple python script to solve

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python

n = 

e = 3

c = 56274920108122478990888092521371739605513959053322262229138771723654033167756128122086229722406180593128664696512912311575327724724695863345048713415525599333

ptext = c**(1/e)

p = hex(int(ptext))
print(p)
```

Running this script returns:
```
0x666c61677b6e4f5f70614444696e6730305f7273617d
Converting this to ASCII we get:

flag{nO_paDDing00_rsa}
```

# Helpful Resources
1) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_(cryptosystem)
2) https://crypto.stackexchange.com/questions/33561/cube-root-attack-rsa-with-low-exponent#33571
